text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to refer to the 'clean hands doctrine' (the principle that an investor\u2019s own wrongful conduct can bar or mitigate treaty protection). The candidate answer discusses the admissibility of host-state counterclaims based on the investor's alleged wrongful conduct (environmental damage), but it never explicitly names or discusses the 'clean hands doctrine' as a distinct jurisdictional or admissibility test. It focuses on consent, nexus, and applicable law for the counterclaim itself, not the doctrine that bars the investor's primary claim based on their own conduct.", "criterion_id": "0d1fd5d7-f2d7-4a42-b60a-213a6647cbd1"}
